questions.question: I am certain …………………….. you have made a mistake.
questions.description: We use that to introduce a noun clause.

questions.question: ……………………….. he got the telegram, he left in a taxi.
questions.description: No sooner should be followed by than.

questions.question: He worked hard ………………………….. he might win the first prize.
questions.description: We use the conjunction so that to introduce purpose. Hence is not a conjunction.

questions.question: …………………………. he is at home, we will see him.
questions.description: We use if to introduce a conditional clause.

questions.question: He was buried near Rome in a place ………………………….. myrtles grow.
questions.description: We can use where to introduce adverb clauses of place.

questions.question: The archers were poorly armed ……………………….. they offered a stubborn resistance.
questions.description: We use but to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: He lost more …………………………. he could afford.
questions.description: We use than after a comparative expression.

questions.question: …………………………. you do not hurry, you will miss the train.
………………………… we do our work sincerely, our master will be angry with us.
questions.description: Unless is similar to if not.

questions.question: Once upon a time a man owned a hen ………………………….. laid a golden egg every day.
questions.description: Either which or that can be used to refer to animals, birds or things.

questions.question: He ran away ……………………….. he was afraid.
questions.description: We use because to introduce the reason.
